intro: Aphelandra gilva, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its long, arching leaves and striking yellow-orange inflorescences. Aphelandra gilva thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant foliage and showy flowers.
